snippet: Administration officials said President Obama’s strategy of conducting airstrikes while relying on Iraqi forces on the ground have yielded gains.
abstract: Obama administration officials defend Pres Obama's strategy for countering Islamic State militants in Iraq; say militants' capture of provincial capital of Ramadi is setback but not a sign of failure.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Administration officials said President Obama’s strategy of conducting airstrikes while relying on Iraqi forces on the ground have yielded gains.

headline.main: White House Won’t Upend ISIS Strategy
headline.print_headline: White House Won’t Upend ISIS Strategy
